channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Jail for man who breached stay-home notice to eat bak kut teh
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who breached a stay-home notice (SHN) and went out to eat bak kut teh on March 23 amid the coronavirus outbreak was sentenced yesterday to six weeks in jail.

item.title: ComfortDelGro taxi rental waiver extended by another month
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Taxi giant ComfortDelGro will extend its full rental waiver to its cabbies by another month following news that safe distancing measures will be tightened and extended till June 1.

item.title: Groceries on wheels in five HDB estates
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Residents in five mature housing estates will not need to travel far to buy groceries, thanks to an initiative dubbed FairPrice on Wheels.

item.title: Four more dormitories under isolation
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Four more foreign worker dormitories have been placed under isolation, bringing the total to 25, even as coronavirus cases from these dorms continue to drive up infection cases here.

item.title: Two charged with verbally abusing public servants
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Two Singaporean men have been charged with verbally abusing public servants in separate incidents during the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Halimah calls on Muslims to support one another
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob has asked Muslims in Singapore to support one another throughout the fasting month of Ramadan, and conveyed her appreciation for their community efforts.

item.title: SIA says 15 staff tested positive and nine have fully recovered
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) has confirmed that 15 staff have tested positive for Covid-19 since last month, with nine having fully recovered and been discharged.

item.title: Man escapes death after apex court acquittal
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A 27-year-old man, who was originally handed the death penalty for driving his friend to pick up drugs, escaped the gallows yesterday after he was cleared by the Court of Appeal .

item.title: Task force aims to boost support for spouses facing abuse at home
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The inter-agency task force addressing violence within families is looking to strengthen support for spouses facing abuse at home, especially amid the extended circuit breaker period.

item.title: Civil servant arrested for leaking info on number of virus cases
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A civil servant has been arrested after she allegedly shared the number of new Covid-19 cases in Singapore with members in a private group who were not authorised to receive the information.

item.title: Lawyer accused of perverting course of justice, hindering police work
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A lawyer, suspended in 2018 for the offensive way he cross-examined a molestation victim - by referring to and staring at her breasts - has allegedly run afoul of the law.

item.title: Thinner crowds at markets with new entry rule
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Crowds at four popular wet markets have thinned in the past two days after stricter entry measures were implemented, the National Environment Agency (NEA) said yesterday.

item.title: Two new cases at separate nursing homes raise concerns
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Two new cases of Covid-19 have surfaced at two nursing homes, again raising concerns about the vulnerability of senior citizens to the disease.

item.title: 58-year-old lorry driver killed in 3-vehicle accident
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A traffic accident on Tuesday night - involving a lorry, a taxi and a car - left one dead and three others injured.

item.title: At least 350,000 in S'pore still commuting to work daily
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

At least 350,000 workers in Singapore are still commuting to work daily, even after the number of services considered essential was reduced on Wednesday to further control the local spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Risk of virus spread in 'blind spots' and potential clusters
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Some at-risk groups remain a potential source of Covid-19 infections and should be watched carefully, even while the focus is on containing others.

item.title: Loan sharks use new tactic to harass debtors
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Even with circuit breaker measures in place, loan sharks have found a way to pester people who owe them money.

item.title: Use jobs support aid to pay staff or lose future payouts: MOM
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Manpower (MOM) will investigate complaints that employers are not using their Jobs Support Scheme payouts to support employee salaries.

item.title: Mega Covid-19 facility coming up at Tanjong Pagar Terminal
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A large facility being set up at Tanjong Pagar Terminal could house up to 15,000 Covid-19 patients or foreign workers, as the number of coronavirus cases in Singapore continues to increase, The Straits Times has learnt.

item.title: March core inflation falls to minus 0.2% amid virus woes
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Inflation was down again last month - a trend that is likely to continue for some time as the pandemic takes a toll on the global economy.

item.title: 1,037 new cases, 982 of them in dorms
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers living in dormitories continued to make up the bulk of new coronavirus cases, with 982 such workers among the 1,037 new cases yesterday, the Ministry of Health said in its daily update.

item.title: Family has been getting help, and will continue to do so: MSF
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A family of six that was reported as having been left with $200 for three weeks has been - and will be - getting a range of assistance from the Government and various community partners.

item.title: Financial institutions continue to offer internships, jobs
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Financial institutions are continuing to offer internships and jobs to tertiary students amid the coronavirus crisis to help graduates find employment in this difficult economic landscape.

item.title: NUS offers 1,000 traineeships, jobs to grads
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The National University of Singapore (NUS) will give a leg-up to its graduates by opening up 200 full-time jobs and 800 paid traineeship positions across its faculties and research institutes as well as in administration.

item.title: Thousands of traineeships for fresh ITE, poly and uni grads
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

On June 1, applications will open for 4,000 of the 8,000 traineeship positions that have been promised for fresh Institute of Technical Education (ITE), polytechnic and university graduates.

item.title: Universities use tech to deter cheating in online exams
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

At least two universities here are turning to technology to send students into a "lockdown" when they take online examinations - to prevent them from cheating.

item.title: Covid-19 patient dies after he is found at hospital staircase landing
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A coronavirus patient who was found motionless at a staircase landing at Khoo Teck Puat Hospital yesterday morning later died from his injuries.

item.title: Who can apply for traineeships?
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Q Do I qualify for a traineeship?

item.title: Sing along to Home tomorrow to thank front-line, migrant workers
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

In a national effort to keep spirits up and thank front-line and migrant workers amid the circuit breaker period, an islandwide singalong to well-loved song Home will take place at 7.55pm tomorrow.

item.title: Tighter virus curbs: Motor, transport firms face bigger blow
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The one-month extension to circuit breaker measures could have a devastating impact on the motor trade and the transport sector, both of which are already reeling from a downward spiral in demand.
